H0.text: Magma is the substance that forms igneous rock and flows out in rivers of lava when it reaches the surface.

H1.text: Granite is a substance that forms igneous rock and flows out in rivers of lava when it reaches the surface.

H2.text: Soil is the substance that forms igneous rock and flows out in rivers of lava when it reaches the surface.

H3.text: Fertilizer is the substance that forms igneous rock and flows out in rivers of lava when it reaches the surface.

A4.text: Magma that is extruded onto the surface during a volcanic eruption is called lava.

A5.text: Magma that cools slowly within a magma chamber usually ends up forming bodies of plutonic rocks such as gabbro, diorite and granite.
